name: Mitral Regurgitation

signs_any: Holosystolic murmur at apex radiating to axilla
Acute severe MR: pulmonary edema, soft/absent murmur

initial_tests: Transthoracic echo (jet severity, LA/LV size, function, mechanism)
TEE if needed for mechanism/surgical planning

all_patients_initial: Treat HTN, AF, and heart failure symptoms
Afterload reduction (ACEi/ARB, vasodilators) in acute or symptomatic MR if not immediately surgical
definitive: Symptomatic severe MR or LVEF ≤60% or LVESD ≥40 mm → mitral surgery (repair preferred over replacement)
Acute severe MR (papillary rupture, chordal rupture, endocarditis): urgent surgery
device: MitraClip (TEER) for selected patients not surgical candidates

vasodilators: Use cautiously in preload-dependent patients with acute MR and hypotension

follow_up: Echo surveillance: mild q3–5y, moderate q1–2y, severe q6–12mo

instructions: Report new or worsening dyspnea, edema, or palpitations
Maintain dental hygiene to reduce endocarditis risk
